016
017package org.tribuo.interop.tensorflow;
018
019import com.oracle.labs.mlrg.olcut.provenance.ConfiguredObjectProvenance;
020import com.oracle.labs.mlrg.olcut.provenance.impl.ConfiguredObjectProvenanceImpl;
021import com.oracle.labs.mlrg.olcut.util.Pair;
022import org.tribuo.Example;
023import org.tribuo.ImmutableOutputInfo;
024import org.tribuo.Prediction;
025import org.tribuo.regression.Regressor;
026import org.tensorflow.Tensor;
027
028import java.util.ArrayList;
029import java.util.Arrays;
030import java.util.List;
031
032/**
033 * Can convert a {@link Regressor} to a {@link Tensor} containing a 32-bit float and a Tensor into a
034 * {@link Prediction} or Regressor.
035 */
036public class RegressorTransformer implements OutputTransformer<Regressor> {
037    private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
038
039    @Override
040    public Prediction<Regressor> transformToPrediction(Tensor<?> tensor, ImmutableOutputInfo<Regressor> outputIDInfo, int numValidFeatures, Example<Regressor> example) {
041        Regressor r = transformToOutput(tensor,outputIDInfo);
042        return new Prediction<>(r,numValidFeatures,example);
043    }
044
045    @Override
046    public Regressor transformToOutput(Tensor<?> tensor, ImmutableOutputInfo<Regressor> outputIDInfo) {
047        float[][] predictions = getBatchPredictions(tensor);
048        if (predictions.length != 1) {
049            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Supplied tensor has too many results, predictions.length = " + predictions.length);
050        } else if (predictions[0].length != outputIDInfo.size()) {
051            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Supplied tensor has an incorrect number of dimensions, predictions[0].length = " + predictions[0].length + ", expected " + outputIDInfo.size());
052        }
053        String[] names = new String[outputIDInfo.size()];
054        double[] values = new double[outputIDInfo.size()];
055        for (Pair<Integer,Regressor> p : outputIDInfo) {
056            int id = p.getA();
057            names[id] = p.getB().getNames()[0];
058            values[id] = predictions[0][id];
059        }
060        return new Regressor(names,values);
061    }
062
063    float[][] getBatchPredictions(Tensor<?> tensor) {
064        long[] shape = tensor.shape();
065        if (shape.length != 2) {
066            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Supplied tensor has the wrong number of dimensions, shape = " + Arrays.toString(shape));
067        }
068        int numValues = (int) shape[1];
069        if (numValues != 1) {
070            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Supplied tensor has too many elements, tensor.length = " + numValues);
071        }
072        int batchSize = (int) shape[0];
073        Tensor<Float> converted = tensor.expect(Float.class);
074        return converted.copyTo(new float[batchSize][numValues]);
075    }
076
077    @Override
078    public List<Prediction<Regressor>> transformToBatchPrediction(Tensor<?> tensor, ImmutableOutputInfo<Regressor> outputIDInfo, int[] numValidFeatures, List<Example<Regressor>> examples) {
079        List<Regressor> regressors = transformToBatchOutput(tensor,outputIDInfo);
080        List<Prediction<Regressor>> output = new ArrayList<>();
081
082        if ((regressors.size() != examples.size()) || (regressors.size() != numValidFeatures.length)) {
083            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid number of predictions received from Tensorflow, expected " + numValidFeatures.length + ", received " + regressors.size());
084        }
085
086        for (int i = 0; i < regressors.size(); i++) {
087            output.add(new Prediction<>(regressors.get(i),numValidFeatures[i],examples.get(i)));
088        }
089
090        return output;
091    }
092
093    @Override
094    public List<Regressor> transformToBatchOutput(Tensor<?> tensor, ImmutableOutputInfo<Regressor> outputIDInfo) {
095        float[][] predictions = getBatchPredictions(tensor);
096        List<Regressor> output = new ArrayList<>();
097
098        String[] names = new String[outputIDInfo.size()];
099        for (Pair<Integer,Regressor> p : outputIDInfo) {
100            int id = p.getA();
101            names[id] = p.getB().getNames()[0];
102        }
103        for (int i = 0; i < predictions.length; i++) {
104            double[] values = new double[names.length];
105            for (int j = 0; j < names.length; j++) {
106                values[j] = predictions[i][j];
107            }
108            output.add(new Regressor(names,values));
109        }
110
111        return output;
112    }
113
114    @Override
115    public Tensor<?> transform(Regressor example, ImmutableOutputInfo<Regressor> outputIDInfo) {
116        float[] output = new float[example.size()];
117        double[] values = example.getValues();
118        for (int i = 0; i < output.length; i++) {
119            output[i] = (float) values[i];
120        }
121        return Tensor.create(output);
122    }
123
124    @Override
125    public Tensor<?> transform(List<Example<Regressor>> examples, ImmutableOutputInfo<Regressor> outputIDInfo) {
126        float[][] output = new float[examples.size()][outputIDInfo.size()];
127        int i = 0;
128        for (Example<Regressor> e : examples) {
129            double[] values = e.getOutput().getValues();
130            for (int j = 0; j < output.length; j++) {
131                output[i][j] = (float) values[j];
132            }
133            i++;
134        }
135        return Tensor.create(output);
136    }
137
138    @Override
139    public boolean generatesProbabilities() {
140        return false;
141    }
142
143    @Override
144    public String toString() {
145        return "RegressorTransformer()";
146    }
147
148    @Override
149    public ConfiguredObjectProvenance getProvenance() {
150        return new ConfiguredObjectProvenanceImpl(this,"OutputTransformer");
151    }
152}
